en: O God, keep not thou silence: Hold not thy peace, and be not still, O God.
hmr: Aw Pathien, ṭawng loin um naw la, Aw Pathien, to zing naw la, um ṭawk ṭawk lul naw rawh.

en: For, lo, thine enemies make a tumult; And they that hate thee have lifted up the head.
hmr: Ngai ta, nangma dotuhai chu an sa mur mur a; Nangma theidatuhai chu an lu an suksâng a,

en: They take crafty counsel against thy people, And consult together against thy hidden ones.
hmr: I mihai vervêktakin an phierrûk a, I mi thuphmanghai chunga hin a se tiengin an inrâwn a.

en: They have said, Come, and let us cut them off from being a nation; That the name of Israel may be no more in remembrance.
hmr: “Thaw ro, an hnam bo khawpin sukbohmang ei tiu, Israelhai hming hrim hrim hi hriet zinga a um ta nawna dingin,” an ta,

en: For they have consulted together with one consent; Against thee do they make a covenant:
hmr: Inthuruolin an inrâwn a, I chungah a se tienga thaw dingin thu an intiem tâwl a.

en: The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites; Moab, and the Hagarenes;
hmr: Edomhai le Ismaelhai puon in dâm, Moabhai le Hagarhai dâm,

en: Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek; Philistia with the inhabitants of Tyre:
hmr: Gebalhai le Ammonhai le Amalekhai dâm, Philistinhai, Tura khuoa umhai leh.

en: Assyria also is joined with them; They have helped the children of Lot. [Selah
hmr: Assuriahai khawm anni tieng an ṭhang veh a, Lota thlahai chu an ṭhang- pui a,

en: Do thou unto them as unto Midian, As to Sisera, as to Jabin, at the river Kishon;
hmr: Annirawi chu Midianhai chunga i thaw ang dâm, Kison vadunga Sisera chunga i thaw ang dâm, Jabin chunga i thaw ang khan thaw ve rawh.

en: Who perished at Endor, Who became as dung for the earth.
hmr: Chuong mihai chu Endor khuoah an bohmang a, Hnuoi dingin êkdûr ang el an lo ni ta kha.

en: Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb; Yea, all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna;
hmr: An mi lienhai chu Oreb le Zeeb i thaw ang khan thaw la, Anih, an lalhai po po chu Zeba le Zalmunna ang khan tukdei rawh.

en: Who said, Let us take to ourselves in possession The habitations of God.
hmr: Chuong mihai chun, “Pathien umnahai chu, Hluopêk ei tiu,” an ti kha.

en: O my God, make them like the whirling dust; As stubble before the wind.
hmr: Aw ka Pathien, anni chu pilvut khu chum chum ang hin the dar la, Businâwi thli imût lêng ur ur ang el hin.

en: As the fire that burneth the forest, And as the flame that setteth the mountains on fire,
hmr: Ram kângtu mei ang le, Tlâng kângtu meichawk ang elin;

en: So pursue them with thy tempest, And terrify them with thy storm.
hmr: Anni chu i thlipuiin hnawt la, I thli natak chun sukṭi rawh.

en: Fill their faces with confusion, That they may seek thy name, O Jehovah.
hmr: Aw LALPA, i hming an zawng theina dingin, An hmêl chu inzaknain suksip rawh.

en: Let them be put to shame and dismayed for ever; Yea, let them be confounded and perish;
hmr: Kumkhuoin, muolpho le lunginzîngtakin um hai sienla, Anih, sukzaka umin bohmang raw se.

en: That they may know that thou alone, whose name is Jehovah, Art the Most High over all the earth.
hmr: Nangma chau hi JEHOVAH hming put, Hnuoi chung po poa Achung- hnungtak i nih ti an hriet theina dingin.
